data.event: In 1889, a post office opened for the community of Union.

event.title: was filed during the following year

data.event: A townsite plat was filed during the following year.
Union City began in 1890 with the arrival of the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway (acquired by the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad in 1891).

event.title: acquired by the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad in 1891

data.event: Union City began in 1890 with the arrival of the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway (acquired by the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad in 1891).

event.title: was based on agriculture, and within four years

data.event: The local economy was based on agriculture, and within four years the town had three grain elevators and a farm machinery dealership.

event.title: May 24, 1973, a tornado rated F4 struck

data.event: On May 24, 1973, a tornado rated F4 struck the Union City area and was the first tornado widely documented by science as part of storm chasing field research.
